definition: Duke of Zhou (11th c. BC), son of King Wen of Zhou 周文王[Zhou1 Wen2 wang2], played an important role as regent in founding the Western Zhou 西周[Xi1 Zhou1], and is also known as the "God of Dreams"
surname Zhou/Zhou Dynasty (1046-256 BC)
to make a circuit/to circle/circle/circumference/lap/cycle/complete/all/all over/thorough/to help financially

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: Zhougong's lording or not is an important political issue in feudal society of China.
sentences.chinese: 周公是否稱王，在封建時代曾是一個重大的政治問題。

sentences.english: This article researches about the vocabulary of the words of Zhougong in JINWENSHANGSHU.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究《今文尚書》周公話語的詞彙。

sentences.english: The book Duke of Zhou Interprets Dreams was usually used as a reference for ancient people to interpret their dreams.
sentences.chinese: 古人常常參照《周公解夢》一書來解讀夢境。

sentences.english: And to him, as well as to find Zhou Gong.
sentences.chinese: 與其想他，還不如去找周公。

sentences.english: Tradition has it that these rules were promulgated by the first great ruler of the dynasty, the Duke of Zhou.
sentences.chinese: 據說這一重大措施是周初的大政治家周公開始頒行的。

sentences.english: The dance "Dawu"was composed by the Duke of Zhou after Emperor Wu successfully overthrew the Shang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 周樂《大武》，是武王伐紂勝利後由周公創編的。

sentences.english: The Duke of Zhou suppressed the rebellion, and Cai Shu was exiled.
sentences.chinese: 周公鎮壓了叛亂，蔡叔被流放。

definition: King Wen of Zhou state (c. 1152-1056 BC), reigned c. 1099-1056 BC as king of Zhou state, leading figure in building the subsequent Western Zhou dynasty, father of King Wu of Zhou 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2] the first Zhou dynasty king
King Wu of Zhou (-1043), personal name Ji Fa 姬發|姬发, reigned 1046-1043 BC as first king of Western Zhou dynasty 1046-1043 BC
King Cheng of Zhou (1055-1021 BC), reigned 1042-1021 BC as the 2nd king of Western Zhou 西周[Xi1 Zhou1], son of King Wu of Zhou 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2]
Jizi, legendary sage from end of Shang dynasty (c. 1100 BC), said to have opposed the tyrant Zhòu 紂|纣 then ruled ancient Korea for Zhōu 周
see Jiang Ziya 姜子牙[Jiang1 Zi3 ya2]
King Zhou of Shang (11th century BC), notorious as a cruel tyrant
Emperor Xin, last ruler of Shang (11th Century BC), famous as a tyrant
Shun (c. 23rd century BC), mythical sage and leader
Yu Shun, one of Five legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4]
Di Yi (died 1076 BC), Shang dynasty king, reigned 1101-1076 BC
see Jiang Ziya 姜子牙[Jiang1 Zi3 ya2]
final name of the Shang dynasty after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
another name for Laozi 老子[Lao3 zi3]
great-grandfather/(old) grandfather/father
King Wu of Zhou, personal name Ji Fa, reigned 1046-1043 BC as first king of Western Zhou dynasty 西周[Xi1 Zhou1] 1046-771 BC
Wu Ding (c. 14th century BC), legendary founder and wise ruler of Shang dynasty
